intro: Viola tripartita f. glaberrima, commonly known as the smoothleaf violet, is a botanical variant of the viola tripartita species. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and typically smaller, pale purple to white flowers. This plant is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The plant has a compact growth habit and is relatively easy to cultivate in cool climates.
